mdRecord.dcterms:title: View of Bathhouse Row towards Arlington Hotel with Fordyce Bathhouse on right
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "Bathhouse Row is a collection of bathhouses, associated buildings, and gardens located at Hot Springs National Park in the city of Hot Springs, Arkansas. The bathhouses were included in 1832 when the Federal Government took over four parcels of land to preserve 47 natural hot springs, their mineral waters which lack the sulphur odor of most hot springs, and their area of origin on the lower slopes of Hot Springs Mountain...Bathhouse Row was designated a National Historic Landmark on May 28, 1987." -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bathhouse_Row [work]
